means: 辩论( debate的第三人称单数 )

sentence.Network_en: In this new book, Harrison brilliantly disentangles complex debates.
sentence.Network_cn: 在这本新作中，哈里森巧妙地理顺了那些纷繁复杂的争论。

sentence.Network_en: The four debates will be compressed into an unprecedentedly short eight-day period.
sentence.Network_cn: 这4场辩论将被压缩到短短8天的时间,这是前所未有的.

sentence.Network_en: His vacuity was a handicap in these debates.
sentence.Network_cn: 在这些辩论中，思想贫乏是他的一个弱点。

PerfectNetExp.abs: (3)continual debates in intervention orientation;（3）介入取向的持续论争;

analytical research on concerned core concepts triggered by a number of typical debates about abortion and euthanasia in medical ethics primary task for modern ethics .医学伦理学中有关堕胎、安乐死问题的争论，都涉及“人”这个概念的定义。
the method used in debates is to present the facts , reason things out , and persuade through reasoning .辩论的时候，必须采取摆事实，讲道理，以理服人的方法。
some to believe that our politics afford to be petty because , in a time of peace , the stakes of our debates appear small .有人认为我们的政治制度是如此的微不足道，因为在和平年代，我们所争论的话题都是无关紧要的。

模拟联合国会议分为正式辩论(formal debate)和非正式辩论(informal debate)。正式辩论Formal Debate 点名Roll Call点名完毕，会议 …
政策辩论（Policy Debate） 政策辩论也被称为学术性辩论，是美国独有的一种以研究为基础的辩论比赛，最早起源于美国一些大学的 …

entry.tran: （各自发表不同观点的）辩论，争论，讨论
entry.def: A debate is a discussion about a subject on which people have different views.

example.ex: An intense debate is going on within the Israeli government...
example.tran: 以色列政府内部正在进行激烈的辩论。

example.ex: There has been a lot of debate among scholars about this.
example.tran: 学者之间对此一直争论纷纷。

entry.tran: (议会或其他机构就某问题在投票前进行的)辩论
entry.def: A debate is a formal discussion, for example in a parliament or institution, in which people express different opinions about a particular subject and then vote on it.

example.ex: There are expected to be some heated debates in parliament over the next few days.
example.tran: 预计接下来的几天里议会将会进行一些激烈的辩论。

entry.def: If people debate a topic, they discuss it fairly formally, putting forward different views. You can also say that one person debates a topic with another person.

example.ex: The United Nations Security Council will debate the issue today...
example.tran: 联合国安理会今天将就这个问题展开讨论。

example.ex: The causes of anorexia are much debated...
example.tran: 关于厌食的起因存在颇多争论。

entry.def: If you debate whether to do something or what to do, you think or talk about possible courses of action before deciding exactly what you are going to do.

example.ex: Taggart debated whether to have yet another double vodka...
example.tran: 塔格特思忖着是否再要一杯双份伏特加。

example.ex: At the moment we are debating what furniture to buy for the house...
example.tran: 我们眼下正盘算着为房子购置什么样的家具。

entry.tran: 存在争论的;有待讨论的;未确定的
entry.def: If you say that a matter is open to debate, you mean that people have different opinions about it, or it has not yet been firmly decided.

example.ex: Which of them has more musical talent is open to debate.
example.tran: 他们之中谁更有音乐天赋还未有定论。

auth_sentence.content: This is also true in the global warming debates.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is also true in the global warming debates.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is also true in the global warming debates.

auth_sentence.content: Everybody debates when to stop calling it an aftershock.
auth_sentence.res_content: Everybody debates when to stop calling it an aftershock.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Everybody debates when to stop calling it an aftershock.

auth_sentence.content: I fear Obama only gets it during the debates.
auth_sentence.res_content: I fear Obama only gets it during the debates.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I fear Obama only gets it during the debates.

Sentence.sentence: Providing powerful hand-held devices is sure to fuel debates over the role of technology in higher education.
